Differently-Abled Homeless Women Part Of Chennai's COVID-19 Fight
Shanthi, a differently-abled master tailor, visits 250 homes everyday to identify symptomatic people in Kodambakkam, a key Covid hotspot in Chennai with around 10,000 positive cases.
Her day starts as early as 7:30 AM and finishes at around 4 PM.
She checks the temperature of residents, quizes them for symptoms, and spreads awareness on wearing masks, frequently washing hands, and social distancing.
Her efforts have even helped the early identification and recovery of four positive people.
Shanthi is among Chennai City corporation's 16,000 non-medical workers who conduct door-to-door screening.
The iniative, authorties say, has led to a 50 per cent fall in positive cases in Chennai's daily tally even as they rise in other Tamil Nadu districts.
Shanthi says not all residents are cooperative.
She adds, "Most people cooperate seeing a differently-abled woman reaching out to them.
Some feel irritated too.
I'd not be worried.
For me, people should be safe.
When I visit them again the next day they are polite.
Establishing a good rapport helps."
And there are several others like Shanthi who stay at the corportation's homeless shelter for differently abled women and help in the fight against Covid-19.
Not far away Kodambakkam, Kavitha, who is also differently-abled, has joined the effort as a supervisor.
Though she has a retrofitted bike, Kavitha walks holding her crutches to meet people.
"I am happy," she says about the decline in numbers, but adds, "I want this to come down to perhaps around 100 a day.
I'm confident we can reach that."

On the ground floor of the homeless shelter where the two stay, Matilda Funceca, a wheelchair basketball player, and Manimekalai, a school teacher, upload all the data sent by around 40 women to Chennai Corporation's server.
Matilda says she has no fear of contracting coronavirus.
"When we help others, God will protect us" she adds.
Asked about the precautions they take, Manimekalai explains: "I wear a mask, follow social distancing and do frequent hand wash.
I also take Kabasura Kudineer, Siddha immunity-boosting drink."
A few months ago, when corona first struck Chennai these differently-abled women used their time and talent to stitch masks for sanitary workers in the city.
Dr Aishwarya Rao, director of the Shelter and Dorcas Research Centre that runs the shelter, said "They adapt according to the need of the hour.
Earlier mask was needed and they rose to the occasion.
Now it's time for community intervention and they readily said yes."
Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu have crossed the two lakh-mark with 6,989 new cases reported in the last 24 hours, which is also the biggest single-day spike, government data shows.
Eighty-nine have died and 7,758 have recovered in the last 24 hours.
The total cases in the state is now 2,06,737.
Mata nakasassu, marasa matsuguni na cikin rundunar Chennai masu yaki da cutar COVID 19

Shantri a wani mai sana'ara dinki mai fama da nakasa, ta kan ziyarci gidaje 250 a kowanne rana don ya gano mutanen da ke dauke da alamomin cuta a tsakanin mutane da ke zaune Kodambakkam, wata unguwa da cutar Korana ta yi kamari a Chennai da ke dauke da wadanda suka kamua da cutar su kimanin 10,000.
A kowacce rana ta kan soma fita ne da sasafe da kimanin karfe 7:30 ta kuma gama zagayenta da misalin karfe 4:00 na yamma.
Ta kan bincika zafin jikin mazuna unguwar, ta kan yi musu tambayoyi dangane da alamomin cutar da yaduwarta da kuma wayar da kai akan muhimmancin sa takunkumi, da yawan wanke hannu, da nisanta juna.
Irin ayyukan da ta ke yi ya taimaka wajen ganewa da wuri da kuma warkewar mutane hudu da suka kamu da cutar.
Shanthi na daga cikin ma'aikata 16,000 ma'akatan kamfanin birnin Chennai wadanda ba mai'aikatan lafiya ba da ke bi gida-gida suna yin gwaji.
Wannan yunkuri, a cewar mahunkuta ya kai ga samun raguwa yaduwar cutar da kashi 50 a alkaluman wadand suka kamu da cutar a kullum a yayin da alkaluman suke tashi a wasu yakunan na Tamil Nadu.
Shanthi ta ce ba duk mazauna wuraren ne ke ba ta hadin kai ba.
Sannan ta kuma kara da cewa, "Yawancin mutane na bayar da hadin kai idan sun ga mata nakasassu ne ke ba su agaji.
Wasu kuma abi na ba su haushi.
Bazan damu ba.
Ni dai burina shine mutane su kasance ba sa cikin hadarin kamuwa da cutar.
Idan na ske ziyartarsu washegari sai su zama su na mutuntani.
Samun kyakkyawar fahimta na taimakawa."
Da akwai wasu da yawa irin Shanthi wadanda suke zauna a inda kamafanin ya tanada na marasa matsuguni na mata nakasa suke taikamakawa a yakin da ake da curtar COVID -19.
Dan nesa kadan daga Kodambakkam, Kavita wacce ita ke fana da wata nakasa ta shiga bayar da ta nata gudunmawar a matsayin mai sa ido.
Duk da cewa tana amfani ne da keken guragun na musamman, Kavitha tana tafiya ne tare da taimakon wasu sanduna biyu wanda da haka ta ke ganawa da mutane.
"Ina cikin farin ciki," ta kuma yi magana kan raguwar yawan adadin da ake samu, amma saia ta kara da cewa "Ina so wannan adadadin ya sauko kasa sosai zuwa kamar 100 a rana.
Kuma ina da karfin gwiwar cewa za mu iya kaiwa ga hakan."

A kasan bene inda aka yiwa marasa matsuguni, inda su biyu suke zaune, MatildaFunceca wata 'yar wasan kwallon kwando da ke amfani da keken guragu, da kuma Manimekalai, wata malamar makaranta, suna aikawa da bayanan da kimanin mata 40 suka aiko musu zuwa ma'adanar bayanai na kamfanin.
Matilda ta ce ita ba ta tsoron kamuwa da cutar Koronabirus.
"Cikin taimakon wasu, Allah zai karemu" ta cigaba da cewa.
Da aka tambayerte game da irin matakan kariyar da suke dauka, Manimekalai ta yi bayanin cewa:"Ina sa takunkumi sannan ina bayar da tazara ina kuma wanke hannunna akai-akai.
Sannan ina kuma shan Kabasura Kudineer, wani abin sha mai inganta sinadarin kariya na Siddha."

A 'yan watannin da suka wuce a lokacin da cutar Korona ta bulla a Chennai wadannan mata maus nakas sun yi amafani da lokacinsu da basirarsu wajen dinka takunkumi da hannu ga mai'aikatan tsabta a garin.
Dabkta Aiswanya Rao darakataa mai kula da cibiyar Bincike da samar na Dorcas mai da matsugunin ya ce. "su kan bayar da taimakon ne daidai da irin bukatara da ake da ita.
A da, ana bukatar takunkumi sai suka yi kokarin samar da shi.
Yanzu kuma ana bukatar tamakawa al'umma nan ma ba su gajiya ba."

A dadin wadanda suka kamu da cutar ta Koronabirus a Tamila Nadu ya haura gejin dubu biyu da karin 6,989 na sabbin alakluman sabbin wadanda suka kamu da cutar a cikin awanni 24 wanda kuma shi ne karuwa ma fi girma a ranar daya, kamar yadda alkaluman gwamnati suka nuna.
Mutane tamanin da tara suna mutu, yayin da 7,758 suka warke daga cutar a ciin awa 24 da suka wuce.
Yawan adadin wadanda suka kamu da cutar a jihar yanzu ya kai 2,06,737.
US Racial Injustice Protests Mount
Protesters have taken to the streets of several U.S. cities to bring attention to racial injustice.
Protests in Portland, Oregon, have been going in for two months, since the May 25 death of George Floyd while in police custody in Minneapolis, Minnesota.
The Trump administration has sent federal officers to Portland, adding additional fuel to the protests.
The demonstrators now are also protesting the federal presence in the city.
In Seattle, police using flash bangs and tear gas arrested 45 people Saturday after demonstrations in support or the protests in Portland turned violent.
Police said more than 20 police officers were injured.
Saturday night, in Austin, Texas, a man was killed when someone shot into a Black Lives Matter march.
Media accounts say the man may have approached a vehicle with a rifle before he was fired upon.
"All I know is that someone dying while protesting is horrible," Mayor Steve Adler of Austin said in a statement.
Adler said he is "heartbroken and stunned."

In Louisville, Kentucky, a group of armed protesters called for justice of Breonna Taylor, a Black woman who died in Louisville when police entered her home without warning on a "no knock" warrant and shot her.
Taylor's boyfriend had fired at the officers first, thinking they were intruders.
One police officer has been fired because of the Taylor incident, but charges have not been brought against the other officers.
The leader of the NFAC group, an armed Black militia involved in the protests, says he wants the police investigation into the Taylor killing to be more transparent.
Police say three NFAC members were injured Saturday when one of the militia's weapons accidentally discharged.
Kungiyar yaki da nuna rashin adalci mai alaka da banbancin launin fata ta Amurka ta gudanar da zanga-zanga
Masu zanga-zanga sun mamaye titinan yawancin biranen Amurka domin jan hankali kan rashin adalaci da ke alaka da launin fata.
Sama da wata biyu ana ta zanga-zanga a Portland, da ke Oregon tun ranar 25 ga watan Mayu bayan mutuwar George Floyd yayin da ya ke tsare a hannun 'yan sanda a Minneapolis da ke Minnesota.
Gwammatin Trump ta aika da jami'an tsaro na gwamnatin tarayya zuwa Portland, wanda hakan ya kara izza wutar zanga-zangar.
Sai zanga-zangar ta rikide ta koma zanga-zangar adawa da zuwan wadannan jami'an garin.

A birnin Seattle 'yan sanda suna amfani da kulake da hayaki mai sa hawaye sun kuma kama mutane 45 a ranar Asabar bayan zanga-zangar da ke goyon bayan zanga-zangar ta birnin Porland ta rikide ta koma tashin hankali.
'Yan sanda suka ce sama da jami'an 'yan sanda 20 suka samu raunuka.
A ranar Asabar da dare a garin Austin ta Texas wani mutum ya rasa ransa yayin da wani yayi harbi a cikin 'yan zanga-zangar Black Lives Matter.
Rahotanni daga kafofin yada labarai na cewa watakila mutumin ne ya je kusa da wata mota da wani a cikinta ke dauke da bindiga, sai aka harbe shi da ita.
" Ni dai abin da na sani shine mutum ya mutu a lokacin da ke zanga-zanga abin da tashin hankali." Magajin gari Steve Daler na Austin ya fada a cikin wata sanarwa.
Adler ya na mai cewa, "na shiga cikin dimuwa da tashin hankali."

A birnin Lousville da ke Kentucky, wasu gungun masu zanga-zanga dake dauke da makami na kiran da a yiwa Breonna Taylor, wata mace bakar fata wacce ta mutu a Lousville a lokacin da 'yan sanda suka kutsa gidanta kwatsam dauke da umarnin kotu na "shiga babu sallama" suka kuma harbeta.
Saurayin Taylor ne ya fara yin harbin 'yan sandan a bisa tunanin cewa masu kutse ne.
An kori wani jami'in dan sanda saboda harbin da ya faru ga Taylor, sai dai sauran 'yan sandan babu abin da aka yi musu.

Shugaban kungiyar NFAC, wata kungiya mai gwagwarmaya da makamai ta bakar fata zalla da ke cikin masu zanga-zangar ta ce tana son 'yan sanda su binciki kisan da aka yi wa Taylor, sannan binciken a yi shi a bayyane.
'yan sanda sun ce uku da ga cikin 'yan kungiyar ta NFAC sun samu raunuka a ranar Asabar a lokacin da bindigar da daya daga cikinsu ta tashi abisa kuskure.
Gottlieb warns uncontrolled coronavirus spread in a community makes it "very hard to open" schools in fall

Washington - Dr. Scott Gottlieb, former head of the Food and Drug Administration, warned Sunday it's going to be "very hard" for school districts to open for the upcoming academic year if there is uncontrolled spread of the coronavirus within their communities.
"For local school districts, I think they need to be looking at what is the spread within the community.
If you have uncontrolled spread within the community, it's going to be very hard to open against that backdrop." Gottlieb said on "Face the Nation."
With the fall semester set to begin in the coming weeks, the Trump administration had been urging school districts to open their doors to students for in-person instruction five days a week.

But the push from President Trump and Education Secretary Betsy DeVos comes as Mr. Trump warned last week the coronavirus crisis will likely "get worse before it gets better" and acknowledged school districts in hot spots may have to delay reopening for a few weeks.
Still, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued guidance Thursday for how best to safely open schools for students.

The guidance calls for schools to follow social distancing, recommend students and staff wear face coverings, and keep students in defined groups to reduce contact with others, among other guidelines.

But the CDC did not provide a benchmark for school administrators on when they should move to close a school in the event of an uptick in coronavirus infections, which Gottlieb said was "unfortunate."
"In the setting of uncertainty and the lack of specific guidance for how to keep schools open, I think more parents are going to err on the side of caution," he said.
"That's why it's very important to get specificity out of what the hard metrics are that the CDC didn't do in its guidance."

Gottlieb said school districts should think about positivity rates in their community, local spread and testing capacity to guide decision-making on whether to keep a school open or shift fully to online learning.
A positivity rate between 5% to 10%, he said, is "starting to get iffy," while above 10% is the "threshold where you really want to think carefully about closing the school districts."

"That is a sign that there is an epidemic underway inside that community," Gottlieb said, adding that it's going to be difficult for parts of Florida, which is an epicenter of the coronavirus epidemic in the U.S., to open their schools for in-person learning next month.
More than 30 states and the District of Columbia are experiencing an uptick in coronavirus infections, with the epicenter of the epidemic currently in the Sun Belt.
But Gottlieb said there are indications cases in some states including Arizona and Texas are beginning to plateau.
While Gottlieb said there are "unmistakable signs" the epidemic is slowing in some states across the Sun Belt, it's "heating up" in others, including South Carolina, Alabama, Indiana and Illinois.
Many governors have instituted mandates requiring people to wear masks when they are in public spaces and halted their phased reopenings in an effort to mitigate the spread of the coronavirus.

Gottlieb said states should consider shutting down bars, limiting the number of people in restaurants, closing movie theaters and other kinds of indoor entertainment venues, and implementing mask mandates to quell the epidemic, steps that allow states to stop short of reverting back to the more stringent restrictions imposed at the start of the pandemic in March.
In addition to states issuing mask mandates, a number of businesses are requiring customers to wear face coverings as well.
McDonald's is among the latest to require face coverings, and the fast food giant joins Walmart, Starbucks and others in implementing their own rules for masks.
Gottlieb said he expects more businesses will implement mask mandates in venues, especially those considered high-risk.

"If we really can manage to keep the epidemic under control heading into the winter until we get to a vaccine or some kind of therapeutic that changes the clinical trajectory of this illness, just with masks that's going to be something relatively simple that we can all do that doesn't really change our lives and allows us to maintain what's really important to us like keeping some businesses open, like getting our kids back to school," he said.
While Mr. Trump has said he will not impose a nationwide mask mandate, he urged Americans last week to wear coverings, saying during a White House press briefing "they have an impact."
Gottlieb ya yi gargadin cewa "zai yi matukar wahala a bude" makarantu da kaka a wuraren da aka kasa dakile yaduwar cutar Koronabirus

Birnin Washington - Dakta Scott Gottlied, tsohon shuguban Hukumar kula da ingancin abinci da magunguna, ya yi gargadin cewa, abubuwa za su yi "tsananin matuka" ga makarantu a gundumomi su bude don soma katatu a shekarar karatu mai zuwa na shekara mai zuwa idan har da akwai rashin dakile yaduwar cutar Korona Birus a wuraren.
Ga makarantun da ke unguwanni da ke gundumomi, Ina ganin suna da bukatar da su rinka kallon dalilan da ke sa cutar ta yadu a wurare.
Idan aka samu matsalar yaduwar cutar a unguwanni ba a iya da dakile ta ba, zaj zo da matular wahala a bude a cikin irirn wannan yanayi." Gottlieb ya ce a "shirin Face the Nation."

Da kusantowar zangona kaarutun na kaka a 'yan makonni, gwamnatin Trump ta na ta kira ga makarantu a gundumomi da su bude azuzuwansu domin dalibai su soma daukar karatu a tsarin gani - gaka a kwnaki biyar na kowanne mako.

Amma wannan matsin lamba daga Shugaba Trump da kuma Sakataren Ilimi Betsy DeVos na zuwa ne a lokacin da Mista Trump ya yi gargadi a makon da ya wuce yana mai cewa cutar Koronabirus na iya " ta'azzara kafin ta yi sauki " sannan suka yarda da cewa makarantun da ke gundumomi a wuraren da ke zafi su jinkirta budewa da 'yan makonni.
Duk da haka, Cibiyar kula da yaduwar cuttuka da dakile su, ta fitar da wata sanarwa a ranar Alhamis kan yadda za a bude makarantu domin dalibai su dawo ba tare da yiwuwar kamuwa da cutar ba.

Sanarwar jagorar na kira ga makarantu da su bi ka'idar bayar da tazara, na kira ga dalibai da kuma malamai su sa takunkumi su kuma sa dalibai a da'irori domina rage cudanya da juna, kadan daga cikin sauran jagororin.

Sai dai hukumar ta CDC ba ta bayar da wani ma'auni na yadda shubannin makarantu za su iya daga karatunsu ko kuma rufe makarantun baki daya idan an samu labarin wani ya kamu da cutar ta Korona, wacce Gottlied ke cewa, " abin takaici ne."

"Cikin halin yanayi na kila-wa-kala da kuma rashin fadin takarmaimai yadda za a ci gaba da barin makarantun a bude, ina jin dai iyaye da yawa za su yi kuskure a wajen daukar matakan kariya" yana mai cewa.
" Shi ya sa ya ke da matukar muhimmanci a samu takamaiman bayani kan ma'auni mai wuya da hukumar ta CDC ta hankalinta bai kai wurin ba."

Gottlied ya ce kamata ya yi makarantun da ke gundumomi su rika tunani kan afkuwar lamarin a wuraren da suke da kuma yadda za a yi gwajin cutar ta yadda za a iya tsai da shawarar uadda za a tunkari lamarin da kuma kom za ci gaba da barin makaranta a bude ko kuma a koma baki daya zuwa karatun ta hnayara yanar gizo.

Yiwuwar kamuwa da cutar tsakanin 5% zuwa 10% ya na mai cewa, "hankula zai soma tashi" yayin da sama da kashi 10% ya zama "matakin da sai ka yi taka tsan-tsan tere da tunanin ko yakamata ka rufe makaranta a yankin baki dayansa."

" Wannan shine alamar cewa lallai annobar ta doso wannan wuri gadan - gadan" Gottlieb yana mai cewa, zai abu ne mai wahala ga wasu yankuna na jihar Florida wacce ta kasance cibiyar annobar Koronabirus a Amurka, da zai sa su bude maukarantunsu a koma karatu kamar yadda a ka saba gani-gaka.
Sama da jihohi 30 ne da kuma gundumar Columbia ne ke fuskantar karuwar wadanda suka kamu da cutar ta Korona, yayin da Sun Belt ya zama cibiyar yaduwarta.
Amma Gottlieb ya ce da akwai abubuwan da suke nuna cewa a wasu jihohi ciki har da Arizona da kuma Texas za su kai kololuwa.

Duk da dai Gottlieb ya ce akwai "alamun da ba za a iya ganewa ba" annobar tana tafiyar hawainiya a wasu jihohin a fadin Sun Belt, tana "ɗumama" a wasu, ciki har da South Carolina, da Alabama, da Indiana da kuma Illinois.

Gwamnoni da yawa sun kafa doka da ke buƙatar mutane su sanya takunkumi lokacin da suke cikin jama'a kuma sun dakatar da sake buɗe wuraren taron jama'a, a cikin yunƙurin rage yaɗuwar ƙwayar cutar ta Koronabirus.

Gottlieb ya ce ya kamata jihohi su yi duba yiwuwar rufe mashaya, da iyakance yawan mutane a gidajen abinci, da rufe gidajen sinima da ma sauran wuraren nishadi na cikin rufaffunn wurare, da aiwatar da dokar rufe fuska don dakile yaduwar annobar, matakan da za su ba jihohi damar dakatar da koma baya ga mafi tsauraran da hani aka sanya a farkon bullar cutar a watan Maris.
Baya ga jihohin da ke bayar da umarnin rufe fuska, yawancin kamfanoni na buƙatar kwastomomi da suma su sanya abubuwan rufe fuska.
McDonald's na daga cikin waɗanda suka buƙaci rufe fuska, da kuma babban wurin sayar da abinci Walmart, Starbucks da sauransu wajen aiwatar da ƙa'idojin kansu na takunkumi.
Gottlieb ya ce yana fatan ganin karin wuraren kasuwanci za su aiwatar da umarnin rufe fuska a wurarensu, musamman ma wadanda ake ganin suna da matukar hadari.

"Idan da gaske ne za mu iya magance cigaba da yaduwar cutar har zuwa lokacin hunturu har sai mun kai ga samun allurar rigakafi ko wani nau'in magani wanda ke canza yanayin tafiyar wannan rashin lafiyar, a likitance, kawai tare da abin rufe fuska wanda zai zama wani abu mai sauƙi wanda za mu iya yin hakan ba zai canza rayuwarmu da gaske ba, kuma yana ba mu damar kiyaye abin da ke da muhimmanci a gare mu kamar buɗe wasu kasuwancin a buɗe, kamar dawo da yaranmu zuwa makaranta, "in ji shi.

Yayin da Mista Trump ya ce ba zai sanya dokar rufe fuska ba a duk fadin kasar, ya bukaci Amurkawa a makon da ya gabata da su sanya makari, yana mai cewa yayin ganawa da manema labarai na Fadar White House "suna da tasiri."
Coronavirus row breaks out on bus as driver gets in fiery exchange over face masks
In the footage passengers and the driver onboard the Arriva bus service in Liverpool clash over the use of face masks.
The bus driver can be heard explaining to a woman that it is not his job to tell passengers to wear face masks.
The bus driver said: "It's not my job to ask everyone who comes on the bus about wearing a mask."
A witness said regarding the incident: "A man and an older woman started ganging up on her and a massive row erupted."
"The bus driver had to get out of his seat and came over to demand what was going on and he told one woman she wasn't even wearing her mask properly."
"That woman then stormed off the bus and said she was going to report the incident."
A spokesperson for Arriva said: "The safety of our customers and employees continues to be our priority.
"The wearing of face coverings continues to be mandatory for customers whilst using public transport (exemptions apply)."
"We have clear guidance and signage for customers in regards to this and all other social distancing measures in place on bus, via social media and our website."
It has been mandatory to wear a face covering when using public transport since June 15.
Worldwide there have been more than 16.3 million COVID-19 cases.
The death toll has reached more than 650,000.
More than 9,900,000 people have recovered from the coronavirus across the globe.
The US has the most COVID-19 cases in the world with more than 4.3 million.
An takaddama ta faru a motar bus yayin da direba ya fusata a sa-in-sa mai zafin kan takunkumi
A cikin wani gajeren hoton bidiyo wasu fasinjoji da direban a cikin motar bus ta Arriva a Liverpool sun kaure da fada akan amfani da takunkumi.
A na jin Direban Bus din na yiwa wata mata bayanin cewa ba aikinsa bane ya fadawa fasinjojin cewa su sa takunkumi.
Direban Bus din na mai cewa: "Ba fa aikina ba ne in fadawa duk wani wanda ya hau motar nan ya sa takunkumi."
A cewar wani wanda ya aka yi abin a gabansa yana mai cewa: "wani mutum da wata mace dattijuwa da suka soma sa baki da mayar mata da magana sai wata gagarumar hayaniya ta barke"
" Da hayaniyar ta yi yawa direban motar tasowa ya yi daga kujerarsa ya kuma zo ya tambayi me ke faruwa sannan ya fadawa matar cewa ba ta ma iya sa takunkumin ba yadda ya kamata"
"Wannan mata cikin fushi ta sauka daga motar tana mai ikirarin cewa za ta je ta kai karar abin da ya faru"
Wani mai magana da yawun kamfanin Arriva a cewa: "Kariyar lafiyar abokan huldarmu da kuma ma'aikatanmu a kullum shine fifikonmu.
"Yin amfani da kyallen rufe fuska zai cigaba da zama tilas ga kwastominmu a yayin da suke amfani abin hawa na jama'a (an kebance wasu da hakan da ta kama)"

"Muna da tsari karara da kuma alamu na fadakarwa ga kwastomominmu su fahimta kan wannan da kuma duk wasu matakan nisantar juna da cikin motocinmu. Wadannan bayanai na shafukanmu da kuma dandalinmu na sada zumunta"
Ya zama dole a sa kyallen rufe fuska a yayin da mutum ke cikin abin hawa na jama'a tun ranar 15 ga watan Yuni.
Yawan adadin wadanda suka kamu da cutar COVID-19 a yanzu a duniya ya kai sama da miliyan 16.3.
Yawan wadanda suka mutu sakamakon kamuwa da cutar ya kai sama da 650,000.
Mutane sama da 9,900,000 ne suka warke daga cutar a fadin duniya.
Amurka ita ke da yawan wadanda suka kamu da cutar COVID -19 a duniya da yawan adadinsu ya zarta miliyan 4.3.
Coles ditches plastic toys for books in new collectibles campaign
"We've really listened, and it was a really key thing in formulating this program," Ms Ronson said.
"We don't think people will want to recycle the books - we think they'll want to keep them, but they can recycle them at home if they wish to."

Ms Ronson said the new campaign had been in the works long before the onset of COVID-19, and despite the pandemic, she believed the timing was "quite good" for a new campaign given the amount of time parents were spending with their children.
Analysts had been concerned shoppers were tiring of the constant collectibles campaigns from major supermarkets, but Ms Ronson said there was no sign of fatigue just yet.
"We're not seeing any of that so far, but we do constantly look out for it," she said.
"We analyse a lot of data, week to week, month to month, to make sure we're launching things that really resonate with the customer base."

Collectible campaigns such as Little Shop were primarily pioneered by Coles in Australia, with the first iteration launching in mid-2018, fuelling one of the supermarket's best-ever single-quarter sales results.

Woolworths has since followed suit with its Lion King Ooshies campaign, which also helped the supermarket supercharge its sales, and most recently, its eco-friendly Discovery Garden promotion, which offered customer free herbs and flowers to plant.

However, with UBS analysts predicting Australia's supermarket sector to have COVID-inflated sales through much of the 2021 financial year, the impact of Coles' new collectibles could be far more muted this time.
Ms Ronson said customers could expect more varied and diverse forms of collectibles campaigns into the future, with promotions such as Little Shop likely to appear less often.
"There's a lot of these collectible-type campaigns to look to around the world, and we're constantly drawing inspiration from overseas," she said.
"We should be doing those sorts of things to make sure we're constantly raising the bar with our own customer base."
Coles ya yi watsi da kayan wasan yara ya rungumi littafai a wani sabon gangami saye-sayen kayyaki.
"Mun yi sauraro na hakika, kuma yana daga cikin muhimman abubuwa da suka sa muka tsara wannan shiri", a cewar Ms Ronson.
"Ba ma tunanin cewa mutane za su sake fito da tsaffin littafansu don sake amfani da su - muna tunanin za su so su ajiye kayansu, amma za su sake amfani da su a gudajensu idan suna son yin haka."

Ms Ronson ta ce wannan sabon gangamin wayar da kai an dade ana tunanin yin sa tun kafin bullar cutar COVID - 19, kuma duk da annobar, ta yarda da cewa yanzu lokacin yin wannan gangamin "ya yi daidai" don soma wannan sabon gangami ganin wadatar lokaci da iyayen da ke da na zama tare da iyayensu.

Masu nazartar lamari na nuna damuwarsu kan yadda masu siyayya kantuna ke nuna gazawa wajen damunsu da aka yi na sayen kayayyaki barkatai daga maya-mayan kantuna, amma Ms Ronson ta ce su dai babu a garesu babu alamar gajiyawa dai.
"Mu ba mu soma ganin komai ba daga wannan abin da ake fada ba, amma mun sa ido" ta na mai cewa.
" Mun yi nazarin bayanai masu yawa, na mako-mako,da wata-wata, domin mu tabbatar mun kaddamar da abubuwan da abokanmu cinikanmu za su so" .

Gangamin sayar da kayayyaki na zabi irin hasali ma dai Coles ne ya soma shi a Australia da sunan Little shop wanda ya kadamar a tsakiyar shekarar 2015 tare da a cigaba da maimaita shi, wanda hakan ya samar da wata guguwar ciniki na ban mamaki a lokaci guda a tsakiyar shekara.

Tuni Woolworths ya biyo baya da nasa gangamin da ya kira 'Lion king Ooshiess wanda ya taimakawa manyan kantuna farfado da cinikinsu , kuma a baya-bayan nan wasu jerin kayayyakin kawa na lambu wanda a tsarin za a ba duk wanda ya saya kyautar filawowi da itatuwan magani su shuka.

Sai dai, duk da hashen manazarta na UBS da ke nuna cewa bangaren manya-manya kantunan sayra da kaya na Australia za su samu tashin farashin kayayyaki sakamakon cutar COVID -19 har zuwa karshen shekarar kudi ta 2021. Tasirin sabon tsarin kayan zanbi na sayarwa na Coles ba zai iaya tasiri ba.
Ms Ronson tace masu sayen kayayyaki sai su sa rai da karin wasu nau'in sayar zababbun kayyaki a gangami na gaba wanda hakan zai sa tsarin irin na 'little shop ' zai ja baya.
"Akwai irin wadannan ganganmin sayen zababbun kayayyaki da za su bullo a duniya, mu dai muna dada samun kwarin gwiwra ne daga irin wadannan abuwa daga kasashen waje.
"Ya kamata mu rika yin irin wadannan abiubuwan donmin mu tabbatar da cewa mun daga darajarmiu da kuma tarin maus cinikin da muke da shi
Utah plane crash: A baby and 2 adults are killed in a backyard crash

The crash happened Saturday afternoon when a Piper PA-32 aircraft carrying six people crashed into a backyard in the city of West Jordan, Federal Aviation Administration spokesman Allen Kenitzer said.
Three people aboard the plane were killed, including the pilot, identified by police as 43-year-old Lee Wyckoff, his 9-month-old baby, and Milda Shibonis, 36, West Jordan police said.
The pilot's wife is in critical condition, and a 2-year-old child has critical burns.
A 12-year-old girl was treated at a local hospital and released, West Jordan Police spokeswoman Jennifer Worthen told CNN on Sunday.
A 72-year-old woman who was in a house struck by the plane is in critical condition, according to a tweet Sunday from the police department.
The crash also damaged three homes, West Jordan city spokesperson Tauni Barker said.
The cause of the crash has not been determined.
The FAA and National Transportation Safety Board are investigating.
Hadarin jirgin sama na Utah: wani jariri da wasu magidanta 2 sun rasa ransu a bayan gidansu

Hadarin ya faru ne a ranar Asabar bayan azahar yayin da wani jirgin sama kirar PA-32 mai dauke da mutane shida ya rikito a bayan wani gida a birnin Jordan ta yamma, wani mai magana da yawun hukumar kula da zirga-zirgan jiragen sama ta kasa da kasa, Allen Kenitszer ya na mai cewa.

Mutame uku da ke cikin jirgen sun mutu ciki har da matukin jirgin wanda 'yan sanda suka gano da cewa sunansa Lee Wyckloff ne dan shekara 43 da 'yarsa mai watanni 9 da haihuwa da Mlda Shbonis mai shekaru 36 da haihuwa a cewar 'yan sandan yammacin Jordan.
Matar matukin jirgin na cikin halin rai kwakwai-mutu kwakwai da kuma wani yaro dan shekara 2 wanda ya kone sosai.

An ba wani dan shekara 12 magani a wani asibiti na unguwa an kuma sallame shi, wata mai magana da yawun 'yan sanda birnin yammacin Jordan mai suna Jennifer Worthen ta fadawa gidan Talbijin na CNN ranar Lahadi.

Wata mata 'yar shekara 72 wacce ta ke gidan a lokacin da jirgin saman ya rikito a kai nma cikin wani mummnuna hali a asibiti a cewar wani sako da hukumar 'yan sanda ta sa dandalin sada zumunta na Tuwita a ranar Lahadi.
Jirgin da ta fado ya kuma lalata wasu gidaje guda uku, a cewar Tim baker mai magana da yawun rundunar 'yan sandan birni yammacin Jordan .
Ba a san dai musabbabin hadarin jirgin ba.
Hukumar kula da zirga-zirgan jirgen sama ta kasa da kuma hukumar kula da kiyaye hadarin ababen hawa ta kasa na bincike.
Anti-racism protesters clash with police in Seattle

Clashes in Seattle between police and anti-racism protesters resulted in dozens of arrests on Sunday, as public anger mounts over US President Donald Trump's planned "surge" of federal agents into main cities.
Demonstrations against racism and police brutality have been ignited by the death in Minneapolis of unarmed African-American George Floyd in May.

Protesters in Seattle slashed car tires and smashed trailer windows during the demonstrations on Saturday, prompting police to declare a riot and clear the streets with pepper spray and flash-bang grenades.
Protesters also set fire to trailers by a construction site for a youth detention facility.
Police said 45 people were arrested while 21 officers were injured.
The march was in support of ongoing protests in nearby Portland, Oregon.
Portland has taken centre stage for the highly controversial crackdown by federal agents ordered by Trump -- one that is not supported by local officials, who say officers use excessive force.
Protesters have marched in Austin, Texas, as well as Louisville, Kentucky; New York; Omaha, Nebraska; California's Oakland and Los Angeles, and Richmond in Virginia.
In Austin, a man was killed in a shooting that broke out Saturday night at a protest in the downtown area of the Texas state capital, police said.
The protests come as Trump faces an increasingly tough battle for re-election in November, and is campaigning on a "law and order" platform.
Masu zanga-zangar wariyar launin fata sun yi arangama da 'yan sanda a Seattle

An yi arangama da tsakanin 'yan sanda da masu zanga-zangar nuna wariyar launin fata wanda ya haifar da kame mutane da yawa a ranar Lahadi, yayin da fushin al'umma ya ke karuwa akan a shirin Donald Trump na "kara" yawan jami'an tsaro na tarayya a manyan birane.

Jerin zanga-zanga kan banbancin launin fata da kuma zaluncin 'yan sanda ya samo asali ne daga kisan George Floyd wani bakar fata ba Amurke dan asalin Africa a Minneapolis wanda ba ya dauke da makami a watan Mayu.

Masu zanga-zangan a Seattle sun yanka tayoyin motoci da kuma farfasa tagoginsu a yayin zanga-zangar a ranar Asabar, wanda hakan ya sa 'yan sanda su kaddamar da yaki da tarzoma su kuma tarwatsa su ta yadda za su bude tituna tare da yin feshin barkonon tsohuwa da kuma tayar da kananan abubuwan fashewa.
Masu zanga - zanga sun cinnawa wasu kananan motoci na wasu kamfanonin gine-gine da ke ginin swara cibiya ta tsare matasa.
'Yan sanda sun ce mutane 45 aka kama yayin da jami'an 'yan sanda 21 aka ji wa ciwo.
Zanga-zangar na goyon bayan irin wannan zanga-zanga ne Portland da ke kusa, Oregon.

Portland ta zama cibiyar gumurzu da Jami'an tsaro na gwmantin tarayya wanda a bisa umarnin Trump da suka janyo cece-ku-ce, daya daga cikin wanda ba shi da goyon bayan jami'ai na garin da suka ce an fi amfani da karfi da ya wuce kima.
Masu zanga-zangar sun yi fito kan tituna a Austin ta Texas da kuma Louisville ta Kentucky; da New York; da Omaha ta Nebraska; da Oakland ta California da Los Angeles, da kuma Richmond da ke Virginia.
A Austin, an kashe wani mutum a wani harbe-harbe da ya barke a daren Asabar wata zanga-zanga da aka yi a tsakiyar babban birnin Texas a cewar 'yan sanda.

Wadannan zanga-zanga na zuwa ne bayan da Trump ya ke fuskantar wani kalubale mai wuya na neman a sake zabarsa a watan Nuwamba, kuma a yayin da yake yakin neman saka zaben nasa a kan "tabbatar da doka da oda."
Seattle protesters clash with police over Trump's 'surge' of federal agents plan

Police in Seattle used flashbang grenades and pepper spray on Saturday against protesters who set fire to construction trailers outside a youth jail, amid a wave of public anger over President Donald Trump's planned "surge" of federal agents into major cities.

The sounds of repeated small detonations rang out in the streets of the city in Washington state, and smoke rose from an area where demonstrators had set fire to trailers by a construction site for the youth detention facility.
Demonstrators slashed car tires and smashed trailer windows.
Police in riot gear faced off against the demonstrators, some of whom held up umbrellas against falling pellets of pepper spray.
The Seattle Times newspaper quoted police as saying 16 people were arrested on suspicion of assault against officers, obstruction and failure to disperse.
Masu zanga-zanga a Seattle sun yi arangama da 'yan sanda shirin karo yawan jami'an tsaro na tarayya

'Yan sanda a Seattle sun yi amfani da abubuwan fashewa marasa hadari da barkonon tsohuwa a ranar Asabar kan masu zanga-zaga wadanda suka cinna wuta kan motocin gine-gine da ke ajiye a kofar wani gidan yari na matasa ana tsaka da fushi kan shirin Shugaba Donald Trump karo jami'an tsaro na tarayya a manyan birane.

Karar fashewar abubuwan akai-akaina ya cika kan tituna da ke cikin birnin jihar Washington, hayaki ya tashi daga wuraren da ake yin zanga-zangar a inda suka cinnawa motocin masu gine-gine da aka ajiye a kofar wata cibiyar tsare matasa da ake ginawa.
Masu zanga-zangar sun yanka tayoyin motocin tare da farfasa tagoginsu.
'Yan sanda a cikin shirin yaki da tarzoma su yi taho mu gama da 'yan zanga zangar wandanda yawancinsu suna rike da lema don kare kansu daga burbushin barkonon tsohuwa da ake fesawa.
Jaridar Seattle Times ta bayar da rahoton cewa 'yan sanda sun ce sun kama mutane 16 a bisa zargin kai hari kan Jami'an 'yan sanda, da tare hanya da kuma kin fashewa daga wurin.
Police work on timeline of Helensburgh teenager's final movements
Detectives investigating the death of a teenager in Helensburgh are trying to build a timeline of his final movements.
The body of Kirk Allan, 19, was discovered at an address in Johnson Court at about 06:25 on Saturday.
A 30-year-old man was arrested and police confirmed on Sunday that he has now been charged in connection with the death.
He is due to appear at Dumbarton Sheriff Court on Monday.
Det Insp Steve Martin said: "Our thoughts remain with Kirk's family and friends at this very difficult time.
Officers will continue to work in and around the community to provide reassurance.

"Inquiries are continuing to find out the full circumstances of what happened, in particular Kirk's movements in the days preceding his death, however, we are not looking for anyone else in connection with the death."
"Yan sanda na aiki kan zirga-zirgar matashi da aka kashe a Halensburg na karshe kafin rasuwarsa
'yan sandan masu bincike na binciken matuwar wani matashi a Halensburg, suna kakarin na tattaro bayanan zirga-zirgann da yayi a lokutansa na karshe kafin mutuwarsa.
An gano gawar Kirk Allan ne a wani wuri da ke Johnson Court da kimanin karfe 06:25 rarnar Asabar
An tsare wani mutum dan shekara 30, 'yan sanda kuma sun tabbatar da cewa ana tuhumarsa dangane da mutuwar matashin.
Za a gurfanar da mutumin a gaban kotun Dumbarton Sheriff a ranar Litinin.
Mai binciken 'yan sanda sifeto Steve Martins ya ce: "muna jajantawa iyalan Kirk da abokansa da basu hakurin wannan rashi
Jami'anmu za su cigaba da aiki ba a ciki da wajen unguwannimu don samar da kwanciyar hankali.

"Ana cigaba da yin tambayoyi domin gano sahihinn abin da ya faru, musamman irin zirga-zirgan da mamacin ya yi a kwanakin kadan kafin rasuwar tasa, sai dai wannan na nufin da akwai wani takamaimai da muke nema ba dangane da kisan.
MATCHDAY: Final day of Premier League; Juve can seal title
A look at what's happening around European soccer on Sunday:
It's the last day of the season and plenty is still at stake: Champions League and Europa League qualification, the final two relegation places, and the Golden Boot scoring trophy.
Manchester United, Chelsea and Leicester are fighting for the remaining two Champions League qualification positions behind champion Liverpool and second-place Manchester City.
The three teams are separated by one point and Leicester hosts United.
Wolverhampton and Tottenham are battling for a finish in the Europa League spots.
Aston Villa, Watford and Bournemouth are looking to avoid the two remaining relegation spots alongside already-demoted Norwich.
With one game left, Leicester's Jamie Vardy is the top scorer with 23 goals, two ahead of Southampton's Danny Ings and three clear of Arsenal's Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
The playoffs for promotion to the Premier League begin with Swansea hosting Brentford in the first leg of their semifinal.
Fulham plays Cardiff in the other semifinal starting Monday.
Leeds and West Bromwich have already been promoted from the second-tier Championship.
Juventus can win a record-extending ninth successive Serie A title with a win over Sampdoria.
That would take the Bianconeri seven points clear of second-placed Inter Milan with two matches remaining.
At the other end of the table, Lecce needs a win at Bologna to boost its chances of avoiding relegation.
Lecce is four points below 17th-placed Genoa, which has played a game more.
RANARWASA: Ranar karshe ta gasar firmiya; juve zai dauki kanbi
Duba da irin abubuwan da ke faruwa a gasar kwallon kafa ta Nahiyar Turai a ranar Lahadi:

Rana ce ta karshe a kakar gasar wasannin kwallon kafa kuma da akwai abubuwa da yawa suke kan gaba: gasar zakarun turai da kuma gasar fidda gwani na cin kofin Europa, da gurabe biyu na karshe a gudun yada kanin wani, da kuma takalmin zinare da na wanda ya fi cin kwallo.

Kungiyar Kwallon kafa ta Manchester United, da Chelsea, da kuma Leicester na fafatawa kan sauran gurabe biyu na gasar wasan zakarun fidda gwani na champions league a bayan zakaru Liverpool da masu mara musu baya Manchester city.
Kungoyin guda biyu da mak daya ne ya raba tsakninsu yayin da kungiyar Leicester ta karbi bakuncin United.
Wolverhampton da Tottenham na fafaftawa don kaiwa ga matakin karshe a gurbin gasan wasanEuropa.
Aston Villa da Watford da kuma Bournemouth tuni suna ta neman kaucewa gurabe biyu da suka rage na koma baya, wanda tuni wacce Norwhich take wannan matsayin.

Da sauran wasa daya tak da ya rage musu, dan kulob din Leicester Jamie Vardy shine kan gaba a cin kwallaye 23, a inda ya zarta Danny Ings na Southampton da biyu, ya kuma ba dan Arsenal Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang rata da kwallaye uku.
Wasannin share fage na tallata gasar ta firimiya ta soma ne da Swansea a inda ta karbi bakuncina Brentford a bugun farko na wasansu na zagayen kusa da na karshe.
Fulham ta kara da Cardiff a wata karawa ta kusa da na karshe somawa daga ranar Litinin.
Leeds da West Bromwich tuni likkafarsu ta daga, daga gurbi na biyu a gasar fidda zakaru.
Kungiyar Juventus za ta iya maimata lashe gasar serie A wanda ta ke yi a karo na tara a jere da doke kungiyar Sampdoria.
Wannan zai fitar da Bianconeri da maki bakwai akan Intermilan masu mataki na biyu da wasannin biyu ne kadai suka rage musu.
A can karshen jerin kungiyoyin, Lecce na bukatar ta doke Bologna domin ta inganta damanmakinta da zai kautar da ita daga faduwa.
Kungiyar na maki hudu kasa da Genoa wacce take mataki na 17, wacce ta buga wasanni da yawa.
Maurice Petty, Hall of Fame engine builder, dies at 81

KANSAS CITY, Kan. (AP) - Maurice Petty, part of a stock car racing dynasty that includes father Lee and brother Richard and the first engine builder to be inducted into the NASCAR Hall of Fame, died Saturday.
He was 81.
Petty's family did not disclose the cause of death.
No funeral arrangements have been announced.
While other family members were acclaimed for their ability behind the wheel, Maurice Petty earned the nickname "The Chief" for his ability to turn a wrench.
He helped his family win 198 races and seven championships in NASCAR's premier series, and he also built engines that carried Hall of Famer Buddy Baker, Jim Paschal and Pete Hamilton to victory.
"The Chief was one of the most talented mechanics in NASCAR history," chairman and chief executive Jim France.
"He provided the power that helped Petty Enterprises define dominance in sports.
While he was known for his work under the hood, Maurice played multiple behind-the-scenes roles, doing what it took to help deliver his cars to victory lane."
Maurice Petty was born March 27, 1939, in Level Cross, North Carolina.
He would tail his father to the track while growing up, and his mechanical know-how soon played an integral part in Lee Petty winning 54 races and three championships.
He made 26 starts in the NASCAR Cup Series from 1960-64, finishing in the top 5 seven times with 16 top-10 runs.

But he quickly decided to focus on what happened under the hood rather than what happened behind the wheel, and that proved to be a good move for his older brother, who would rely on his engines during his period of dominance.
Richard, who would take on the nickname "The King," won his first championship along with The Chief when he drove a Plymouth to the 1964 title.
They won again in 1967, back-to-back titles in 1970 and "71, and added three more before the 1970s drew to an end.
The seven titles remains tied with Dale Earnhardt and Jimmie Johnson for the most in history.
"Maurice Petty was one of the true pioneers in NASCAR who helped build one of NASCAR's dominant teams in Petty Enterprises," Hall of Fame executive director Winston Kelley said in a statement.
"Although the record shows 212 victories, Petty has well over 250 wins to his credit considering all the engines he built for his competitors.
Chief will forever be remember as one of the best to build power plants in NASCAR."
Lee Petty died in 2000 and Maurice Petty's wife of 52 years, Patricia, died in 2014.
He also was the uncle of former driver and broadcaster Kyle Petty and Truck Series crew chief Trent Owens.
"While we have lost one of NASCAR's true, gritty pioneers and heroes, Maurice Petty's legacy and memory will always be remembered, preserved, celebrated and cherished," Kelley said.
"We offer our sincere condolences to the Petty family."
Maurice Pretty, injniya kuma mai kera inji, dan cikin zauren shahararru, ya rasu yana da shekaru 81 a duniya.

Birni Kansas, Kan (AP) Maurice Pettu daya daga cikin zuriyar gidan shaharar tseren motoci da ya hada da mahafii Lee da yaya Richard da kuma injiniya na farko da magini da shaharar su ta suka shiga zaurren shararru na NASCA, ya mutu a ranar Asabar.
Shekarunsa 81 da haihuwa.
Iyalan Petty ba su bayyana sanadiyyar mutuwar ta sa ba.
Babu wata sanarwa ta shirye-shiryen janaizarsa
Yayin da sauran 'yan uwansa suka yi fice a irin kwazonsu da kwarewarsu na iya sarrafa stiyarin mota, Maurice Petty kuwa ya samu lakabin "shugaba" ne saboda yadda ya san karfe da kuma sarrafa shi.

Ya taimaki gidansu lashe gasar tsere 198 da kuma gasar fidda zakaru na jerin gasar tsere na NASCA firimi ya kuma kira injinan da gwanayen tuki Halla of famer Buddy Baker, da Jim Paschal, da Hamilton suka hau, suka kai ga nasara da kuma shahara.
"Sarki na daya daga masu basira kera inji da gyaransa a tarihin NASCAR", a cewar shugaba da kuma babban jami'i Jima France.
"Ya samar da karfin da ya taimakawa kamfanin Petty Enterprises tabbatar da dorewar ci gabansa a wasannin tsere.
Yayin da ya yi suna a aikinsa a karkashin mota, Maurice ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a bayan fage da yawa, yana yin abim da ya sani na taimaka wajen kai motocinsa ga nasara"
An haifi Maurice Petty a rarnar 27 ga watan Maris a shekarar 1939, a wani wuri da ake kira Level Crossing, North Carolina.
A lokacin yana karami, ya ka bi mahaifinsa zuwa wurin tsere, sannu a hankali har ya zama kusa a cikim 'yan Lee Petty da suka lashe gasar tsere 54 da kuma gasar zakaru guda uku.
Ya shiga tsere 26 a gasar cin kofin NASCAR daga shrekarun 1960 zuwa 64, a inda ya kai ga matak na 5 har sau biyar a inda ya kai 16 a sma da kuma tser100

Amma cikin sauri ya yanke shawarar ya mayar da hankali kan abinda ke karkashin mota a maimakon abin da ke bayn sitiyari, kuma hakan sai ya kasance shawara mai kyau da zai taimakaw yayansa, wanda zai dogara da karfin injinansa har ya kai ga nasara
Richard, wanda ya ke amsa lakabin "Sarki" ya lashe gasarsa ta farko ta gasar zakarun tare da shuganba yayin da ya yi tuki a gasar Playmouth har zuwa ga gasar shekarar 1964 ta neman suna
Sun kuma sake lashe gasar a shekarar 1967, kai da kai, a shekarar 1970 da kuma 71 , ya kuma sake maimaita wannan nasara kafina shekarar 1970 da ta kawo karshen lamarin,
Nasarorin gasa guda 7 sun kasance a hannun Dale Earnhardt da Jimmie Johnson har zuwa karshen tarihi

"Maurice Petty na daya daga cikin wandanda aka soma da su asali a NASCAR wadanda suka taimaka wajen gina daya daga cikin 'yan wasan NASCAR da suka yi mamaye komai a kamfanin Petty Enterprises". Shugaban zauren shahararru kuma darakta mai cikakken Winston Kelly ya na mai cewa a wata sanarwa da ya fitar,
" Duk da cewa ajiyayyaun bayanai sun nuna nasarori 212, Petty yana da nasarori sama da 250 da ya sanu la'akari da cewa duk injinan da ya kera dga abokan gasarsa.
Za mu cigaba da tuna sarki a matsayin daya daga cikin kwararraun da suka kera mana injina a NASCAR da aka samu nasarori da su.
Lee petty ya rasu a shekara ta 2000 matar Maurice Petty mai suna Patricia wacce suke tare tsawon shekara 52 ta rasu a shekarar 2014
Kuma shi kawu ne ga tsohon direba kuma mai watsa labarai Kyile Petty da da kuma a Trent Owens shugaban ma'aikatan shirin mai dogon zango mai suna Truck
Kelley ya cigaba da cewa, "yayin da muka yi rashin daya daga cikin 'yan asali na gaskiya kuma gwarzo a NASCA abubuwan da ya yi zamu allkintasu, mu kiyayesu, mu kuma yayata su.
"muma mika ta'aziyyarmu tare da matukar juyayi ga iyalan Petty"
Gareth Bale's situation at Real Madrid is 'unsatisfactory for everyone', says Toni Kroos
Real Madrid midfielder Toni Kroos says Gareth Bale's situation at the Spanish side is 'unsatisfactory for everyone'.

Bale did not feature in any of the last seven games and was a peripheral figure in Los Blancos' LaLiga celebrations ahead of a summer stand-off as the player looks to stay and see out his contract and the club hope he will leave.
"There is no way to avoid the situation being unsatisfactory for everyone," Kroos told the Lauschangriff Endlich was mit Sport! podcast.
"They certainly didn't sign him to play as little as he is now.
"I think in principle he wanted to leave last summer and that the club said 'yes' in principle and then 'no' after that.
"I don't know if he's still a little angry because of that. It's a difficult matter."
Asked if the situation had a negative effect on the atmosphere at Real, Kroos said: "Certainly not as much as it might seem.
"Everything is good with the team. I have known him for six years and we have won some important things together."
Yanayin Gareth Bale a Real Madrid 'bai gamsar da kowa ba', in ji Toni Kroos
Dan wasan tsakiya na Real Madrid Toni Kroos ya ce halin da Gareth Bale ke ciki a kungiyar ta Sipaniya 'bai gamsar da kowa ba'.

Bale bai taka rawar a zo a gani ba a duk wasanni bakwai da suka gabata, kuma ya kasance mutum ne na daban a bikin da Los Blancos ke yi na bikin LaLiga gabanin tsawaita lokacin bazara yayin da dan wasan ke son ci gaba da zama tare da ganin kwantiraginsa kuma kungiyar na fatan zai tafi.
"Babu wata hanyar da za a kaucewa lamarin kasancewar bai gamsar da kowa ba," in ji Kroos a hirarsa da Lauschangriff Endlich mit Sport! wani shiri na podcast.
"Tabbas ba su sanya masa hannu ba don ya taka leda a taikaice ba kamar yadda yake a yanzu.
"Ina ganin a ka'ida ya so barin kulob din a bazarar da ta gabata kuma kungiyar ta ce 'eh' bisa manufa sannan kuma 'a'a' bayan haka.
"Ban sani ba ko har yanzu yana ɗan fushi saboda wannan. Abin da 'yar matsala."
Da aka tambaye shi ko lamarin ya yi wani mummunan tasiri ga yanayin kungiyar ta Real, Kroos ya ce: "Tabbas bai kai yadda za a iya tsammani ba.
"Komai yana tafiya daidai a kungiyar. Na san shi tsawon shekaru shida kuma mun samu nasara a wasu muhimman abubuwa tare."
Tree Branches Downed as Hurricane Hanna Passes Through Southern Texas

Hurricane Hanna weakened to a tropical storm after it made landfall on the coast of southern Texas on Saturday, July 25, but officials warned the storm still had potential to lead to "life-threatening" flash flooding.
The National Weather Service (NWS) said heavy rainfall remained the greatest threat in southern Texas and northeastern Mexico as the storm moved west-southwest on Sunday.
Jorge Castillo shared this footage on Twitter, and told Storyful he filmed this footage outside his home in Combes, Texas, on Sunday morning.
Guguwar Hanna ta kayar da bishiyoyi yayin da ta ratsa ta kudancin Texas

Guguwa mai dauke da ruwan sama ta Hanna ta sassauta gudunta da karfinta bayan da ta fada a gabar teku na kudancin Texas a ranar Asabar 25 ga watan Yuli, amma jami'ai sun yi gargadin cewa guguwar har yanzu na kafin da zata kai ga matakin "barazana ga rayuwa" na ambaliya ruwa.

Hukumar Kula da Yanayi ta kasa (NWS) ta ce ruwa mai zuba da bakin kwarya ta kasance babbar barazana a kudancin Texas da kuma arewa maso gabashin Mexico a lokacin da gaguwar ta soma matsawa zuwa yamma -kudu amso yamma a ranar Lahadi.
Jorge Castillo ya yada wannan karamin bidiyon a Tuwita, ya kuma bayar da labarin da ya dauka, ya kuma dauki wannan bidiyon ne a kofar gidansa a Combes a Texas a ranar Lahadi da safe.
Octavia Spencer calls on Hollywood to increase casting of people with disabilities
The actress is part of a new PSA that calls for increased inclusion of those with disabilities in entertainment.
The campaign coincides with Sunday's 30th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).
The video shows Spencer discussing the importance of everyone being able to see themselves and their lives accurately reflected on screen.
"Nothing can replace lived experience and authentic representation," she said.
"That's why it's imperative that we cast the appropriate actor for the appropriate role."
Spencer discussed the impact she felt seeing a family of color on screen as a young girl watching the show "Good Times."
The series, which ran on CBS from 1974 to 1979, was created by Norman Lear and broke barriers as television's first African American two-parent family sitcom.
Octavia Spencer ta yi kira ga 'yan Hollywood da su kara mutanen da ke da nakasa a finafinai
Wannan na daga cikin sabon shirinta na jan hankali PSA da ke kira da a kara yawan wadanda ke da nakasa a harkar nishadantarwa.
Wannan gangami da ta soma ya zo daidai da bikin murnar cika shekara 30 ta Lahadi da samar da dokar Amurkawa nakasassu (ADA).
Bidiyon da ta yi ya nuna Spencer ta na tattauna muhimmancin na kowa ya ga kansa da kuma rayuwarsa an nuna ta yadda ya kamata a fina finai da talbijin.
"Babu wani abin da zai maye gurbin rayuwa ta hakika da kuma wakilci na gaskiya" ta na mai cewa.
"Don haka yake da matukar muhimmanci mu sa jarumin da ya dace a gurbin fim din da ya dace."
Spencer ta yi magana akan tasirin da ta ke ji na kallon da banbancin launi a a akwatunan talbijin a lokacin da ta ke yarinya ta ke kallon shirin "Good Times."

Shririn na talbijin mai dogon zango wanda CBS ta rika sa wa daga shekarar 1974 zuwa 1979, Norman Lear ne ya kirkire shi kuma hakan ya duk wasu shinge a matsayin shirin da talbijin na farko da ya nuna 'yan Amurka masu asalin Africa na iyaye biyu a wasan barkwanci.
Angler 'seen throwing beer bottle at seal' in Devon
An angler threw a beer bottle at a seal when it interfered with his fishing line, a charity has said.
Photos taken at Hope's Nose, near Torquay, appear to show a man hurling a projectile at the creature from a cliff.
Duncan Kenny, who took the pictures, said the grey seal was hunting when the angler emptied the bottle and launched it, hitting the animal on the back.
Mr Kenny called it "appalling and inconsiderate behaviour."
He said he was collecting litter at the Devon beauty spot with members of the Seal Project conservation charity when he witnessed the attack on Sunday morning.
"The seal made an attempt to get the fishing line," he said.
"The angler finished his beer, drained the bottle and threw it at the seal.
"The bottle hit the seal on the back and it swam off."
Mr Kenny said that "fortunately seals are robust creatures," but said the seal was simply doing what was in its nature.
"By throwing a glass bottle at it you are stopping it from hunting," he said.
The Seal Project said it was "not an isolated case" and it had received "numerous reports of this aggressive behaviour recently."
In a Facebook post, it said volunteers had collected 12 bags of rubbish during Sunday's visit to Hope's Nose and observed "multiple examples of antisocial behaviour."
All seals are protected under the Conservation of Seals Act and people are advised to stay away from them.
An ga wani mai kamun kifi 'ya jefi giwan ruwa da kwalbar giya' a Devon
Wani wanda ya ke fatsa ya jefi wata dabbana ruwa da kwalbar giya a lokacin da dabbar ta katse masa tarunsa, a cewar wata kungiyar agaji.
Wasu hotuna da aka dauka a Hope Nose, kusa da Torquay, na nuna wani mutum ya jifan dabbar ruwan da wani abu daga bakin wata gaba.
Duncan Kenny wanda ya dauki hotunan ya ce, dabbar ruwan ta fito kiwo ne a lokacin da mai kamun kifin ya kurbe abin da ya ke sha a wata kwalba kafin ya jefi dabbar da ita a inda ya same ta a baya.
Mista Kenny ya kira lamarin "tashin hankali da nuna rashin sanin yakamata."

Mutumin yana mai cewa yana tattara shara ne a wurin shakatawa na Devon tare da 'yan kungiyar agaji mai rajin tattalin kare dabbar ruwan, a lokacin da ya ga mutumin ya kai wannan hari a safiyar Lahadi.
"Dabbar ruwan dai ta yi kokarin kaiwa ga fatsar da mutumin ya jefa ne" a na mai cewa.
"Mai kamun kifin da ya kwankwade giyarsa, sai kawai ya jefi dabbar ruwan da ita.
"Kwalbar ta sami dabbar ruwan an bayansa da hakan ta sa ya bi ruwa ya yi tafiyarsa."
Mista Kenny ya na mai cewa "an dai sa a dabbar ruwan tana da aukin jiki, "amma dabbar ta na yin abin da ya ke dabi'arta ne kawai.
"Wannan jifanta da ya yi da kwalba hana ta yin farautarta ya yi" in ji mutumin.
Shirin kula da dabbar ruwan na mai cewa, "wannan ba sabon abu ba ne" dama ta sha samun rahotanni na faruwar irin wannan halin mugunta a baya-bayannan."

A wani sako da ta sa a shafinta na dandalin sada zumunta na Facebook, ta ce masu aikin sa kai sun tattara shara tare da jikankuna 12 a yayin wannan ziyara da suka kai Hope's Nose suna kuma lura da "misalai na halaye marasa kyau."
Dukkannin dabbobin ruwa na karkashin kariyar dokar kula da kuma alkinta dabbar ruwa, kuma ana shawartar mutane da su rika kauce wadannan dabbobin.
Tory MPs accuse union chiefs of wanting civil servants to 'stay at home forever'
Tory MPs accuse union chiefs of wanting civil servants to 'stay at home forever' after defying Boris Johnson's call for them to get back into the office
Union chiefs were last night accused of wanting staff to "stay at home forever" after defying Boris Johnson's clarion call for workers to get back to the office.
Tory MPs reacted with anger after the Public and Commercial Services Union told their members to challenge bosses who ordered them back to their desks.

Former Minister Andrew Percy said it was "unacceptable" that vital public-sector work such as issuing passports was going undone while private employees had toiled to keep the country going during the coronavirus crisis.

"It's unacceptable for them to refuse to come back to work while people in distribution centres and factories around the country have continued to go to work to feed civil servants during this period," he said.
"Many of those workers would now like a holiday and can't have one because of this refusal to go back to work in offices which can be achieved safely.
"The union chiefs cannot have a policy of stay at home forever - especially not now that we know people can return to work safely."

Following the Prime Minister's call, Alex Chisholm, the Civil Service's new chief operating officer, last week told all ministries that it was time to "change the default that civil servants should work from home and accelerate the return to the workplace from August 1."
But the Public and Commercial Services Union told its 200,000 members they did not have to accept that guidance, claiming it was a political issue.
A spokesman for the PCS, Britain's largest civil service union, said the back-to-the-office demand "is not based on our members" health and safety, or on helping our economy.
It is based entirely on political pressure being exerted by some Tory MPs who are demanding that the Civil Service is used as an example to get everybody back to work.
"Our advice to members is clear: if you are working from home and you get approached by anyone in your department asking you to now go back to work, don't just accept that's what you have to do."
The dispute comes amid growing concerns over delays to passports caused by home-working, with more than 400,000 people now said to be waiting for their applications to be processed.
The Home Office has now said it will "seek to expedite" applications from Britons due to travel within the next 14 days and who have been waiting on the Passport Office for more than four weeks.

The PCS has admitted that some people are having to wait for as long as 143 days for passports but insists that "small and often cramped offices" make social distancing difficult for the Passport Office's 4,000 staff.
Former Cabinet Minister David Davis urged civil service union chiefs to "behave responsibly" and work with the Government to find way of getting people back to their workplaces.
He added that if he was in Government, he would be asking union leaders: "What are you suggesting? That you stay [at home] all summer?"
However, Mr Johnson's plea to get people back to their offices has also gone unheeded by some of Britain's top firms.
A study of big employers with a total of 400,000 staff between them found that only about 40,000 of them have returned to the workplace.
'Yan majalisa daga jam'iyyar masu ra'ayin rikau na zargin shugabannin kungiyoyin kwadago da cewa suna so ne ma'aikata da su 'zauna a gida hara abada'

'Yan jam'iyyar masu ra'ayin rikau a majalisar dokokin Brutaniya na zargin shugabannin kungiyoyin kwadago da son ma'aikata da su 'zauna a gida na hara abada' bayan sun bijirewa kiran Boris Johnson na cewa su koma bakin aikinsu

Shugabannin kwadagon a daren jiya an zargesu da cewa suna so ma'aikata so "zauna a gida na har abada" bayan da ma'aikatan suka yi kunnen uwar shegu da kiran da Boris Johnson yayi musu na ma'aikatan su koma bakin aikinsu.

'Yan Majalisara daga jam'iyyara 'yan mazan jiya sun mayar da maratani ne cikin fushi bayan da shugabannin kungiyar ma'aikatan kula da harkokin kasuwanci na jama'a suka umarci 'ya'yan kungiyar da su kalubalanci shugabanninsu a wurin aiki da suka umarce su da su dawo bakin aiki.

Tsohon Minista Andrew Percy na cewa "ba za mu amince da wannan ba" wannan bangare ba jama'a mai matukar muhimmanci da ke gudanar ayyuka kamar bayar da Fasfo na tafiye-tafiye a daina bayan ma'aikata kamfanoni masu zaman kansu na faman sahan wahalar ciyar da kasar gaba a lokacin da ake tsaka da fama da cutar Koronabirus.

"Ba zamu amince da rashin komawarsu bakin aiki ba a yayin da wuraren da ake rarraba abinci da kuma masana'antu na cigaba da aiki domin ciyar da ma'aikatan gwamnati a wannan a hali da ake ciki" yana mai cewa.

"Yawancin wadannan ma'aikata za kuka suce daga bayab suna bukatar su tafi hutu kuma ba za a basu ba saboda kin komawa bakin aikin da suka yi wanda kuma za su iya yin haka ba tare da jefa kansu cikin hadari ba.

" Shgabannin kwadago ba za su fito da wannan tsirfa ta a cigaba da zama a gida ba na har abada - ba dai a yanzu ba da musamman mu ka san cewa ma'aikata za su iaya komawa bakin aikinsu lafiya ba tare da fuskantara wani hadari ba."

Bayana kiran da Shugaba na Britaniya ya yi, Alex Chisholm ssabon shugaban ma'aikata na kasar a makon jiya ya fadawa duk ma'akatun gwamanati cewa "yanzu lokacin ne da za a sauya daga yadda aka saba na ma'aikata su rika aiki daga gida, su yi gaggawan komawa ofisoshinsu daga 1 watan Agusta."

Sai da kungiyar kwadagon ya ma'aikaytan da ke kula da kasuwanci da al'amura na jama'a ta fadawa 'ya'yanta da suka kai 200,000 da cewa su ba sua amince da wannan umarni ba, kungiyar na mai ikirarin cewa wanann batu ne na siyasa.

Wani mai magana da yawun PC, wata kungiyar kwadago ta ma'aikatan gwamanati wacce ita ce mafi girma a Britaniya na cewa, "wannan kira na a koma aiki a ofisoshi "bai yi la'akari da lafiyar 'ya 'yanmu ba" da kawara da su daga shiaga hadari da kuma taimakawa tattalin arzikin kasa.

Wannan kira an dora shi ne kacokan a kan matsin lamba na siyasa da 'a majalisa 'yan jam'iyyar masu ra'ayin rikau wadanda ke da bukatar ganin cewa sun yi amfani da ma'aikatan gwamnati a matsayin misali domin su sa kowa ya koma da ayyukansa ofis.
"shawararmu ga 'yan kungiya a bayyane ya ke: duk lokacin da ka ke aikinka daga gida kuma wani ya tunkare ka daga wurin aikinka da maganar cewa ka koma gida, kar ma ka saurare shi"

Wannan takaddama na zuwa ne yayin da ake tsaka damuwa mai karuwa kan jinkirin da ake samu na fasfon tafiye-tafiye sakamakon halin aiki daga gida da ake yi. Sama da mutane 400,000 ne da suka cika takardun neman fasfon ke jira a ba su.

Ma'aikatar da harkokin cikin gida ta kasar yanzu ta ce za ta san yadda "gaggauta" duba takardun neman fasfon daga 'yan asalinn kasar wadanda suke shirin yin tafiya a cikin kwanaki 14 kuma suna kan jira a duba bukatun nasu a ofishin bayar da fasfo din har tsawon sama da makwannni huɗu.

Kungiyar kwadagon ta PC ta yarda da cewa wasu mutanen sun mika bukatunsu na fasfo din har na tsawon kwanaki 143, amma kuma ta dage cewa "kananan ofisoshi da wasu lokutun ke fama da cikowa" na hana a nisantar juna kamar yadda ya kamata ga ma'aikatan ofishin su 4,000.

Wani tsohon minista a gwamnatin kasar David Davis ya yi kira ga shugabannin kungiyar kwadago da su yi rika "sara suna duba bakin gatari" tare da hada hannu da gwamnati don yin aiki tare don samo yadda za a gano hanyar da mutane za su koma bakin aikinsu.
Sannan ya kuma kara da cewa da ina cikin gwamnati, tambayar shugabannin 'yan kwadagon zai yi:"mecece shawararku? Na ku zauna [a gida] duk tsawon lokacin hunturu?"
Sai dai kiran da Mista Johnson ya yi na ma'aikata su koma ofisoshinsu bai sa wasu manya-manyan kamfanoni na kasar ta Brtianiya sun yi aiki da shi ba.
Wani nazari da aka yi na kamfanonin da suke da yawan ma'aikata 40,000 a tskaninsu an gano cewa ma'aikata 400,000 ne kawai suka koma bakin aikinsu.
